texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: GUIDELINES ON THE ADOPTION OF THE FLEXIBLE WORK ARRANGEMENT IN THE DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION
texts.text: GUIDELINES ON THE ADOPTION OF THE FLEXIBLE WORK ARRANGEMENT IN THE DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION

texts.label: text
texts.orig: To:
texts.text: To:

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Undersecretaries Assistant Secretaries Bureau and Service Directors Regional Directors Schools Division Superintendents Public Elementary and Secondary School Heads All Others Concerned
texts.text: Undersecretaries Assistant Secretaries Bureau and Service Directors Regional Directors Schools Division Superintendents Public Elementary and Secondary School Heads All Others Concerned

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1 The Department of Education (DepEd) issues the enclosed Guidelines on the Adoption of the Flexible Work Arrangement in the Department of Education pursuant to Civil Service Commission Memorandum Circular (CSC MC) No. 6, 2022 or the Policies on Flexible Work Arrangements in the Government, as amended by CSC MC No. 01, s. 2025, and Commission on Audit-Department of Budget and Management Joint Circular No. 2022 or the Policies on the Adoption of Flexible Work Arrangement for Contract of Service and Job Order Workers in Government.
texts.text: 1 The Department of Education (DepEd) issues the enclosed Guidelines on the Adoption of the Flexible Work Arrangement in the Department of Education pursuant to Civil Service Commission Memorandum Circular (CSC MC) No. 6, 2022 or the Policies on Flexible Work Arrangements in the Government, as amended by CSC MC No. 01, s. 2025, and Commission on Audit-Department of Budget and Management Joint Circular No. 2022 or the Policies on the Adoption of Flexible Work Arrangement for Contract of Service and Job Order Workers in Government.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2 The mechanisms; procedures, and standards stipulated herein shall guide all DepEd offices and schools,  including the heads of offices, human resource management officers, and DepEd personnel on the implementation of flexible work arrangements in the Department.
texts.text: 2 The mechanisms; procedures, and standards stipulated herein shall guide all DepEd offices and schools,  including the heads of offices, human resource management officers, and DepEd personnel on the implementation of flexible work arrangements in the Department.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: All DepEd Orders, Memoranda, rules and regulations, and other  related issuances or parts thereof that are inconsistent with this Order and its provisions are repealed, rescinded, or modified accordingly .
texts.text: All DepEd Orders, Memoranda, rules and regulations, and other  related issuances or parts thereof that are inconsistent with this Order and its provisions are repealed, rescinded, or modified accordingly .

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 4 This Order shall take effect 15 from its approval, issuance, and publication on the DepEd website and shall remain in force unless otherwise repealed, rescinded, or modified accordingly. Certified of this Order shall be registered with the Office of the National Administrative Register (ONAR) at the University of the Philippines Law Center (UP LC) , UP Diliman, Quezon days copies City .
texts.text: 4 This Order shall take effect 15 from its approval, issuance, and publication on the DepEd website and shall remain in force unless otherwise repealed, rescinded, or modified accordingly. Certified of this Order shall be registered with the Office of the National Administrative Register (ONAR) at the University of the Philippines Law Center (UP LC) , UP Diliman, Quezon days copies City .

texts.label: list_item

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: GUIDELINES ON THE ADOPTION OF THE FLEXIBLE WORK ARRANGEMENT IN THE DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION
texts.text: GUIDELINES ON THE ADOPTION OF THE FLEXIBLE WORK ARRANGEMENT IN THE DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Rationale
texts.text: Rationale

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1 The COVID-19 pandemic disrupted the operations of the Department of Education (Department), necessitating a shift from traditional face-to-face learning to alternative modes ofinstruction, digitalization of processes, and remote work arrangements for staff and educators Despite these challenges, the Department has successfully ensured the continuity of basic education services while prioritizing the health and safety of employees through the implementation of information and communications   technology strategiesHowever, the threat of similar occurrences, including natural and man-made calamities and transportation issues, persists.
texts.text: 1 The COVID-19 pandemic disrupted the operations of the Department of Education (Department), necessitating a shift from traditional face-to-face learning to alternative modes ofinstruction, digitalization of processes, and remote work arrangements for staff and educators Despite these challenges, the Department has successfully ensured the continuity of basic education services while prioritizing the health and safety of employees through the implementation of information and communications   technology strategiesHowever, the threat of similar occurrences, including natural and man-made calamities and transportation issues, persists.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Civil Service Commission Memorandum Circular (CSC MC) No. 6, s. 2022 entitled Policies on Flexible Work Arrangements in the Government" , as amended, institutionalizes the policies, systems and standards on work arrangements that may be adopted by government offices to provide a safe workspace for government officials and employees and to ensure the continuous delivery of   public service, particularly during emergent disruptive situations caused either by natural and man-made calamities, crises, traffic congestions, and the institutionalization of energy-efficiency and conservation as a national way of life.
texts.text: Civil Service Commission Memorandum Circular (CSC MC) No. 6, s. 2022 entitled Policies on Flexible Work Arrangements in the Government" , as amended, institutionalizes the policies, systems and standards on work arrangements that may be adopted by government offices to provide a safe workspace for government officials and employees and to ensure the continuous delivery of   public service, particularly during emergent disruptive situations caused either by natural and man-made calamities, crises, traffic congestions, and the institutionalization of energy-efficiency and conservation as a national way of life.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3 In addition, CSC through MC No. 2,s. 2021 dated 01 March 2021, enjoined all   government entities to formulate a Public Service Continuity Plan (PSCP) to ensure continuous delivery of services to the public amidst any disruption Correspondingly, DepEd, through a Press Release numbered PR-24-04-024 issued last 12 April 2024, declared that the flexible work arrangements to be implemented shall be adaptable and responsive work schemes for government officials and employees to manage any current or emergent situations caused either by natural and man-made calamities or any other situation
texts.text: 3 In addition, CSC through MC No. 2,s. 2021 dated 01 March 2021, enjoined all   government entities to formulate a Public Service Continuity Plan (PSCP) to ensure continuous delivery of services to the public amidst any disruption Correspondingly, DepEd, through a Press Release numbered PR-24-04-024 issued last 12 April 2024, declared that the flexible work arrangements to be implemented shall be adaptable and responsive work schemes for government officials and employees to manage any current or emergent situations caused either by natural and man-made calamities or any other situation

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 4 Further, the Metropolitan Manila Development Authority (MMDA) issued MMDA Resolution No. 24-08, urging all national government agencies in the National Capital Region to implement a modified working schedule from 7:00 am to 4:00 pm to alleviate traffic congestion, especially during hours The Civil Service Commission (CSC) supported this initiative through an advisory published on February 21, 2024, promoting the Adoption of Flexible Work Arrangements  (FWAs) in the Government to Improve the Traffic Situation in Metro Manila. The advisory reiterated the possible work schemes and reminded   agencies to ensure continuous public service delivery from 8:00 am to 5:00 pm during core working hours. It also emphasized the need for agencies to develop internal guidelines on FWA. peak
texts.text: 4 Further, the Metropolitan Manila Development Authority (MMDA) issued MMDA Resolution No. 24-08, urging all national government agencies in the National Capital Region to implement a modified working schedule from 7:00 am to 4:00 pm to alleviate traffic congestion, especially during hours The Civil Service Commission (CSC) supported this initiative through an advisory published on February 21, 2024, promoting the Adoption of Flexible Work Arrangements  (FWAs) in the Government to Improve the Traffic Situation in Metro Manila. The advisory reiterated the possible work schemes and reminded   agencies to ensure continuous public service delivery from 8:00 am to 5:00 pm during core working hours. It also emphasized the need for agencies to develop internal guidelines on FWA. peak

texts.label: text
texts.orig: NG
texts.text: NG

texts.label: text
texts.orig: AWARAN
texts.text: AWARAN

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 5 Similar situations are experienced by DepEd employees assigned in highly urbanized cities like Metro Cebu and Metro Davao, who are from other cities or from nearby provinces where the employees need to travel from their residences to the office travailing the discomfort of heavy traffic in the metropolis or bearing the high cost of fuel and toll fees. living daily
texts.text: 5 Similar situations are experienced by DepEd employees assigned in highly urbanized cities like Metro Cebu and Metro Davao, who are from other cities or from nearby provinces where the employees need to travel from their residences to the office travailing the discomfort of heavy traffic in the metropolis or bearing the high cost of fuel and toll fees. living daily

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 6 Lastly, COA and DBM released Joint Circular No 1, 2022 dated September 13, 2022 entitled "Policies on the Adoption of Flexible Work Arrangements for Contract of Service (COS) and Job Order (JO) Workers in Government' to provide an inclusive policy on flexible work arrangements in the government by ensuring that the needs and expectations of other workers in the government are addressed in view of the circumstances brought about by natural and man-made calamities, disasters, and other similar situations.
texts.text: 6 Lastly, COA and DBM released Joint Circular No 1, 2022 dated September 13, 2022 entitled "Policies on the Adoption of Flexible Work Arrangements for Contract of Service (COS) and Job Order (JO) Workers in Government' to provide an inclusive policy on flexible work arrangements in the government by ensuring that the needs and expectations of other workers in the government are addressed in view of the circumstances brought about by natural and man-made calamities, disasters, and other similar situations.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 7 In view of the above, this Order aims to establish the internal guidelines of the Department to implement the abovementioned issuances on the adoption of flexible work arrangements in DepEd offices to prioritize the health and safety officials and employees, particularly   during emergent and disruptive situations, while ensuring the continuous delivery of services and the achievement of agency mandates , targets, and programs This measure foster work-life balance, promote the use of information communication technology in current work processes and systems and ensures the provision of efficient public service to all learners , clients and stakeholders in any situation
texts.text: 7 In view of the above, this Order aims to establish the internal guidelines of the Department to implement the abovementioned issuances on the adoption of flexible work arrangements in DepEd offices to prioritize the health and safety officials and employees, particularly   during emergent and disruptive situations, while ensuring the continuous delivery of services and the achievement of agency mandates , targets, and programs This measure foster work-life balance, promote the use of information communication technology in current work processes and systems and ensures the provision of efficient public service to all learners , clients and stakeholders in any situation

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: II Scope of the Policy
texts.text: II Scope of the Policy

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The flexible work arrangements stipulated in this Order shall cover all nonteaching and related-teaching officials and employees, Contract of Service (CoS), and Job Order (JO) Personnel (collectively referred to as "DepEd Personnel?) in all governance levels of DepEd offices, all public elementary, junior, and senior high schools, and community learning centers (CLCs) .
texts.text: The flexible work arrangements stipulated in this Order shall cover all nonteaching and related-teaching officials and employees, Contract of Service (CoS), and Job Order (JO) Personnel (collectively referred to as "DepEd Personnel?) in all governance levels of DepEd offices, all public elementary, junior, and senior high schools, and community learning centers (CLCs) .

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Teaching personnel shall adhere to the class schedule and arrangement adopted at the start of the classes consistent with the Learning and Service Continuity Plan as of the School Improvement Plan (SIP) . part
texts.text: Teaching personnel shall adhere to the class schedule and arrangement adopted at the start of the classes consistent with the Learning and Service Continuity Plan as of the School Improvement Plan (SIP) . part

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Definition of Terms
texts.text: Definition of Terms

texts.label: text
texts.orig: For the purposes of these guidelines, the following terms are defined as follows:
texts.text: For the purposes of these guidelines, the following terms are defined as follows:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1 Combination of Flexible Work Arrangements refers to the adoption of combinations of FWAs that are prescribed in this policy .
texts.text: 1 Combination of Flexible Work Arrangements refers to the adoption of combinations of FWAs that are prescribed in this policy .

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2 Contract of Service (CoS) Personnel refers to the engagement of the services of an individual, learning service provider or technical expert to undertake a special project or job within a specific period.
texts.text: 2 Contract of Service (CoS) Personnel refers to the engagement of the services of an individual, learning service provider or technical expert to undertake a special project or job within a specific period.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3 Flexiplace refers to an output-oriented work arrangement which authorizes DepEd officials or employees to render service at alocation away from their office, on a temporary basis duly approved by the head of office / agency.
texts.text: 3 Flexiplace refers to an output-oriented work arrangement which authorizes DepEd officials or employees to render service at alocation away from their office, on a temporary basis duly approved by the head of office / agency.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Work from Home (WFH) refers to a type of flexiplace arrangement where DepEd officials or employees work at home or their residence_
texts.text: Work from Home (WFH) refers to a type of flexiplace arrangement where DepEd officials or employees work at home or their residence_

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 4 Flexitime refers to a work arrangement where offices adopt flexible time for DepEd Personnel starting from 7:00 AM to 7:00 PM on a daily basis, provided that the required forty (4O)-hour workweek is complied with.
texts.text: 4 Flexitime refers to a work arrangement where offices adopt flexible time for DepEd Personnel starting from 7:00 AM to 7:00 PM on a daily basis, provided that the required forty (4O)-hour workweek is complied with.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Flexitime shall be classified into two (2) categories as follows:
texts.text: Flexitime shall be classified into two (2) categories as follows:

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Fixed Flexitime refers to a fixed schedule wherein an DepEd Personnel is required to arrive at work on the fixed schedule and is expected to render forty (40) hours of work per workweek.
texts.text: Fixed Flexitime refers to a fixed schedule wherein an DepEd Personnel is required to arrive at work on the fixed schedule and is expected to render forty (40) hours of work per workweek.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Full Flexitime refers to a flexible schedule wherein a DepEd Personnel may opt to arrive at work anytime between 07:00 am to 09:00 am and is expected to render forty (40) hours of work per workweek.
texts.text: Full Flexitime refers to a flexible schedule wherein a DepEd Personnel may opt to arrive at work anytime between 07:00 am to 09:00 am and is expected to render forty (40) hours of work per workweek.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 5 Head of Functional Office refers to the individual directly supervising day-to-day   operations of a DepEd office /school/ community   learning center (CLC), which includes Executive Committee members, Directors, SDSs, school/ CLC heads, division chiefs, and other designated officials authorized by the Head of Office to supervise personnel   within their jurisdiction.
texts.text: 5 Head of Functional Office refers to the individual directly supervising day-to-day   operations of a DepEd office /school/ community   learning center (CLC), which includes Executive Committee members, Directors, SDSs, school/ CLC heads, division chiefs, and other designated officials authorized by the Head of Office to supervise personnel   within their jurisdiction.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 6 Heads of Office refers to the highest official in each governance level. For the Central Office (CO), of office refers to the Secretary or the designated Undersecretary / Assistant Secretary / Bureau or Service Director   supervising a specific   strand /bureau / service / office /unit. For Regional Offices (ROs), "head of office" refers to the Regional Director (RD) while for Schools Division the Schools Division Superintendent (SDS)
texts.text: 6 Heads of Office refers to the highest official in each governance level. For the Central Office (CO), of office refers to the Secretary or the designated Undersecretary / Assistant Secretary / Bureau or Service Director   supervising a specific   strand /bureau / service / office /unit. For Regional Offices (ROs), "head of office" refers to the Regional Director (RD) while for Schools Division the Schools Division Superintendent (SDS)

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Home /Residence refers to either permanent and/or temporary place of residence as declared in his /her recent Personal Data Sheet (PDS) submitted to the Personnel Division / Section/ Unit.
texts.text: Home /Residence refers to either permanent and/or temporary place of residence as declared in his /her recent Personal Data Sheet (PDS) submitted to the Personnel Division / Section/ Unit.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 8 Job Order Personnel refer to personnel who perform piece work (pakyaw) or intermittent or emergency jobs such as clearing of debris on the roads, canals, waterways, etc. after natural/man-made disasters /occurrences and other manual/trades and crafts services such as carpentry, plumbing, electrical and the like
texts.text: 8 Job Order Personnel refer to personnel who perform piece work (pakyaw) or intermittent or emergency jobs such as clearing of debris on the roads, canals, waterways, etc. after natural/man-made disasters /occurrences and other manual/trades and crafts services such as carpentry, plumbing, electrical and the like

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 9 On-site refers to official workstations where DepEd Personnel are required to physically report for the workday that includes office / school premises, fieldwork sites, partner facilities for DLMs, distribution and pick-up sites, and other workstation-related venues outside of the residence.
texts.text: 9 On-site refers to official workstations where DepEd Personnel are required to physically report for the workday that includes office / school premises, fieldwork sites, partner facilities for DLMs, distribution and pick-up sites, and other workstation-related venues outside of the residence.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 10 Personnel With Medical Conditions (PMC) refers to DepEd officials or employees who are recuperating from a medical condition, supported by a medical certificate issued by an attending physician, but are still able to perform regular work assignment at an alternate worksite, officials and employees who are undergoing medical rehabilitations due to accidents, Osteogenesis   Inperfecta, cancer, diabetes   mellitus, chronic kidney disease, and other analogous diseases.
texts.text: 10 Personnel With Medical Conditions (PMC) refers to DepEd officials or employees who are recuperating from a medical condition, supported by a medical certificate issued by an attending physician, but are still able to perform regular work assignment at an alternate worksite, officials and employees who are undergoing medical rehabilitations due to accidents, Osteogenesis   Inperfecta, cancer, diabetes   mellitus, chronic kidney disease, and other analogous diseases.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1l Skeleton Workforce refers to a work arrangement   where a minimum number of DepEd Personnel is required to man the office to render service when full staffing is not possible.
texts.text: 1l Skeleton Workforce refers to a work arrangement   where a minimum number of DepEd Personnel is required to man the office to render service when full staffing is not possible.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: IV Policy Statement
texts.text: IV Policy Statement

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The Department shall ensure the protection of health, safety, and general welfare of its employees. It shall be sensitive and responsive to the needs, situations and circumstances of its personnel. It seeks to boost the morale and enhance the welfare of DepEd Personnel by giving them the opportunity to accomplish their tasks through their   preferred work environments and arrangements, as applicable, thereby increasing productivity and performance, and allowing a work-life balance.
texts.text: The Department shall ensure the protection of health, safety, and general welfare of its employees. It shall be sensitive and responsive to the needs, situations and circumstances of its personnel. It seeks to boost the morale and enhance the welfare of DepEd Personnel by giving them the opportunity to accomplish their tasks through their   preferred work environments and arrangements, as applicable, thereby increasing productivity and performance, and allowing a work-life balance.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: This policy further aims to institutionalize relevant and   appropriate work arrangements for DepEd Personnel while   ensuring   delivery of and nondisruption of public service in order to achieve the objectives set in its strategic plan under any circumstance.
texts.text: This policy further aims to institutionalize relevant and   appropriate work arrangements for DepEd Personnel while   ensuring   delivery of and nondisruption of public service in order to achieve the objectives set in its strategic plan under any circumstance.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: With the Department's commitment to continuous development and improvement, this policy seeks to implement progressive approaches to ensure delivery of  quality basic education through improved   performance   utilizing effective Flexible Work Arrangement options
texts.text: With the Department's commitment to continuous development and improvement, this policy seeks to implement progressive approaches to ensure delivery of  quality basic education through improved   performance   utilizing effective Flexible Work Arrangement options

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: V General Policies
texts.text: V General Policies

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Continuity of DepEd Programs and Services
texts.text: Continuity of DepEd Programs and Services

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a. The Secretary, Undersecretaries and Assistant Secretaries, Bureau and Service Directors, Regional Directors, and Schools Division Superintendents shall ensure their availability for decision-making and effective supervision of all work arrangements at all times.
texts.text: The Secretary, Undersecretaries and Assistant Secretaries, Bureau and Service Directors, Regional Directors, and Schools Division Superintendents shall ensure their availability for decision-making and effective supervision of all work arrangements at all times.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b Heads of Office shall give priority to the delivery of the following essential services within their jurisdiction:
texts.text: b Heads of Office shall give priority to the delivery of the following essential services within their jurisdiction:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: i. Health and emergency frontline services;
texts.text: Health and emergency frontline services;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: iii.School operations and activities stipulated in school calendar per DepEd Order (DO) No. 009, s. 2024 and subsequent issuances to be released by the Department;
texts.text: iii.School operations and activities stipulated in school calendar per DepEd Order (DO) No. 009, s. 2024 and subsequent issuances to be released by the Department;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ii. Operationalization of the National Learning Recovery Plan (NLRP) ;
texts.text: Operationalization of the National Learning Recovery Plan (NLRP) ;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: iv Services that support the above-mentioned and other general operations such as but not limited to:
texts.text: iv Services that support the above-mentioned and other general operations such as but not limited to:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a Administrative and Security Services;
texts.text: a Administrative and Security Services;

texts.text: b Financial Services;

texts.orig: Human Resource Management Services;

texts.orig: e Planning Services;
texts.text: e Planning Services;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: d. Information, Communication, and Technology Services;
texts.text: Information, Communication, and Technology Services;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: f. Legal Services;
texts.text: Legal Services;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: h Procurement Services;
texts.text: h Procurement Services;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: g Public Assistance Services;
texts.text: g Public Assistance Services;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: i. Staff assistance to Executive Decision-Making; and
texts.text: Staff assistance to Executive Decision-Making; and

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: j. Other critical services to be identified by the authorized DepEd officials_
texts.text: Other critical services to be identified by the authorized DepEd officials_

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Heads of Office, upon the recommendation of the Head of Functional Office, shall determine the appropriate work arrangements to be implemented in their respective jurisdiction based on the following considerations:
texts.text: Heads of Office, upon the recommendation of the Head of Functional Office, shall determine the appropriate work arrangements to be implemented in their respective jurisdiction based on the following considerations:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1 Office mandates /functions;
texts.text: 1 Office mandates /functions;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: iii. Functions processes services that can only be performed on-site;
texts.text: Functions processes services that can only be performed on-site;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ii. Exigency of service;
texts.text: Exigency of service;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: iv Functions processes / services that can be   performed through telecommuting, online platforms or other strategies (see Annex A);
texts.text: iv Functions processes / services that can be   performed through telecommuting, online platforms or other strategies (see Annex A);

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: vi. Border and transport considerations;
texts.text: Border and transport considerations;

texts.label: list_item

texts.text: Health status and conditions of individual personnel;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: vii. Other directives that may be assigned by the Heads of Offices in the CO, RO, and/or SDO; and
texts.text: Other directives that may be assigned by the Heads of Offices in the CO, RO, and/or SDO; and

texts.label: list_item

texts.text: viii Specific circumstances of their employees and/or locality of residence or office location.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: d. The adoption of FWA may be allowed based on the circumstances and conditions outlined in these guidelines. Therefore, Heads of Office are expected to review the needs of their clientele, office mandates and functions, and other parameters set forth herein,  including the assessment of employees whose functions may be performed off-site or other work arrangements, as basis for the planning and implementation of FWAs. Heads of Office within his /her discretion can amend, cancel or disapprove the flexible  work arrangement based on the needs and priorities of his , her office.
texts.text: The adoption of FWA may be allowed based on the circumstances and conditions outlined in these guidelines. Therefore, Heads of Office are expected to review the needs of their clientele, office mandates and functions, and other parameters set forth herein,  including the assessment of employees whose functions may be performed off-site or other work arrangements, as basis for the planning and implementation of FWAs. Heads of Office within his /her discretion can amend, cancel or disapprove the flexible  work arrangement based on the needs and priorities of his , her office.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 2 General Rules for Flexible Work Arrangements (FWA)
texts.text: 2 General Rules for Flexible Work Arrangements (FWA)

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a All DepEd Personnel, shall render not less than (40) hours of work a week, exclusive time for lunch. forty
texts.text: a All DepEd Personnel, shall render not less than (40) hours of work a week, exclusive time for lunch. forty

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b The Heads of Office shall ensure their availability for decision-making and effective   supervision of all at all times. Likewise, shall ensure the continuous delivery of service in the respective offices during the core working hours of 8:00 am to 5:00 pm on working including lunch break. they days,
texts.text: b The Heads of Office shall ensure their availability for decision-making and effective   supervision of all at all times. Likewise, shall ensure the continuous delivery of service in the respective offices during the core working hours of 8:00 am to 5:00 pm on working including lunch break. they days,

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: C DepEd Personnel under any Flexible Work Arrangement are required to attend the flag raising ceremony at exactly eight 0 clock in the morning (8:00 am) of every Monday as provided in Republic Act No. 8491 otherwise known as the and Heraldic Code of the Philippines. Flag
texts.text: C DepEd Personnel under any Flexible Work Arrangement are required to attend the flag raising ceremony at exactly eight 0 clock in the morning (8:00 am) of every Monday as provided in Republic Act No. 8491 otherwise known as the and Heraldic Code of the Philippines. Flag

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: d DepEd officials and employees reporting on-site shall be entitled to compensatory overtime credit or overtime pay pursuant to CSC and Department of Budget and Management (DBM) Joint Circular No. 02, s. 2015 (Policies and Guidelines on Overtime Services and Overtime for Government Employees) and DO 30, 2016 (Policies and Guidelines on Overtime Services and Payment in the Department of Education) as amended by DO 5, s. 2019 for services rendered beyond the normal eight (8) hours on scheduled workdays or forty (40) hours Pay
texts.text: d DepEd officials and employees reporting on-site shall be entitled to compensatory overtime credit or overtime pay pursuant to CSC and Department of Budget and Management (DBM) Joint Circular No. 02, s. 2015 (Policies and Guidelines on Overtime Services and Overtime for Government Employees) and DO 30, 2016 (Policies and Guidelines on Overtime Services and Payment in the Department of Education) as amended by DO 5, s. 2019 for services rendered beyond the normal eight (8) hours on scheduled workdays or forty (40) hours Pay

texts.label: text
texts.orig: a week, and those rendered on rest holidays and special non working exclusive of time for lunch, subject to availability of funds and the applicable accounting and auditing procedures. days, days,
texts.text: a week, and those rendered on rest holidays and special non working exclusive of time for lunch, subject to availability of funds and the applicable accounting and auditing procedures. days, days,

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: e CoS and JO are entitled to compensatory overtime credit or overtime pay pursuant to COA and DBM released Joint Circular No 1, s. 2022 (Policies on the Adoption of Flexible Work Arrangements for Contract of Service [COS] and Job Order [JO] Workers in Government) and as provided for in their respective Service Agreement /s or Contracts.
texts.text: e CoS and JO are entitled to compensatory overtime credit or overtime pay pursuant to COA and DBM released Joint Circular No 1, s. 2022 (Policies on the Adoption of Flexible Work Arrangements for Contract of Service [COS] and Job Order [JO] Workers in Government) and as provided for in their respective Service Agreement /s or Contracts.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: f DepEd officials and employees may apply to any flexible work arrangement,   endorsed /recommended by their respective heads of office without   prejudice to the DepEd officials' or employees' participation Or involvement in official activities of the agency outside of their approved flexible work schedule.
texts.text: f DepEd officials and employees may apply to any flexible work arrangement,   endorsed /recommended by their respective heads of office without   prejudice to the DepEd officials' or employees' participation Or involvement in official activities of the agency outside of their approved flexible work schedule.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 3 . Flexible Work Arrangements in DepEd
texts.text: 3 . Flexible Work Arrangements in DepEd

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: a. Flexitime
texts.text: a. Flexitime

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1 DepEd Personnel under Flexitime work arrangement shall be required to report for work for five (5) a week from Monday to Friday, equivalent to forty (40) hours a week, exclusive of time for lunch days
texts.text: 1 DepEd Personnel under Flexitime work arrangement shall be required to report for work for five (5) a week from Monday to Friday, equivalent to forty (40) hours a week, exclusive of time for lunch days

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ii. The adoption of Flexitime shall start not earlier than 7.00 am and end not later than 6.00 pm Under this work   arrangement,   DepEd Personnel may choose their time-in in the morning and time-out daily for the duration of the period subject to the approval of the Head of Functional Office.
texts.text: The adoption of Flexitime shall start not earlier than 7.00 am and end not later than 6.00 pm Under this work   arrangement,   DepEd Personnel may choose their time-in in the morning and time-out daily for the duration of the period subject to the approval of the Head of Functional Office.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Heads of Functional Office shall ensure that the public is assured of their frontline services from 8:00 am to 5:00 pm, including lunch break.
texts.text: Heads of Functional Office shall ensure that the public is assured of their frontline services from 8:00 am to 5:00 pm, including lunch break.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: iii Flexitime during ceremony days shall be shortened allowing DepEd Personnel to log-in from 7.00 am to 8.00 am only and shall end upon the completion of the required eight (8)-hour workday. flag
texts.text: iii Flexitime during ceremony days shall be shortened allowing DepEd Personnel to log-in from 7.00 am to 8.00 am only and shall end upon the completion of the required eight (8)-hour workday. flag

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: iv Existing rules on tardiness and undertime shall apply to this work arrangement.
texts.text: iv Existing rules on tardiness and undertime shall apply to this work arrangement.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: V Offices may adopt any of the following Flexitime options based on the considerations provided in Section V.1.C of this policy:
texts.text: V Offices may adopt any of the following Flexitime options based on the considerations provided in Section V.1.C of this policy:

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: a Full Flexitime
texts.text: a Full Flexitime

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Full flexible working hours shall start from 7:00 am to 9:00 am and ends from 4:00 pm to 6.00 pm.
texts.text: Full flexible working hours shall start from 7:00 am to 9:00 am and ends from 4:00 pm to 6.00 pm.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. A DepEd Personnel under this arrangement shall report for work at any time between 7:00 am to 9:00 am and shall complete the required eight (8) hours of work per DepEd officials or employees who report for work past 9:00 am shall be considered tardy while those who arrive between 7:00 am day.
texts.text: A DepEd Personnel under this arrangement shall report for work at any time between 7:00 am to 9:00 am and shall complete the required eight (8) hours of work per DepEd officials or employees who report for work past 9:00 am shall be considered tardy while those who arrive between 7:00 am day.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: to 9:00 am but fail to complete the required eight (8)-hour workday shall be considered to have been undertime.
texts.text: to 9:00 am but fail to complete the required eight (8)-hour workday shall be considered to have been undertime.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3 Full flexitime shall be limited to 7:00 am to 8.00 am during ceremony DepEd Personnel who arrive past 8:00 am shall be considered tardy. only flag days.
texts.text: 3 Full flexitime shall be limited to 7:00 am to 8.00 am during ceremony DepEd Personnel who arrive past 8:00 am shall be considered tardy. only flag days.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: b. Fixed Flexitime
texts.text: b. Fixed Flexitime

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1 DepEd Personnel under the Fixed Flexitime schedule shall choose from the following fixed work schedules subject to the approval of the head of their Head of Functional Office:
texts.text: 1 DepEd Personnel under the Fixed Flexitime schedule shall choose from the following fixed work schedules subject to the approval of the head of their Head of Functional Office:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. In approving the fixed work schedule of DepEd Personnel, the Head of Functional Office shall ensure be continuous provision of services in their respective offices from 7:00 am to 6:00 pm.
texts.text: In approving the fixed work schedule of DepEd Personnel, the Head of Functional Office shall ensure be continuous provision of services in their respective offices from 7:00 am to 6:00 pm.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3 The chosen work schedule shall be the fixed schedule of DepEd Personnel, which may be changed only after six (6) months, when necessary, subject to of a written request at least thirty (30) prior to the start of the intended change of work schedule and approval of the Head of Functional Office prior to its implementation. filing days
texts.text: 3 The chosen work schedule shall be the fixed schedule of DepEd Personnel, which may be changed only after six (6) months, when necessary, subject to of a written request at least thirty (30) prior to the start of the intended change of work schedule and approval of the Head of Functional Office prior to its implementation. filing days

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 4 A fifteen (15)-minute grace period shall be allowed for DepEd officials or employees under the Fixed Flexible Work Schedule, regardless of number of times in a month_ However, in order to complete the required eight (8) hours of work in a the number of minutes of late arrival in a may be offset by staying for an equivalent number of minutes of late arrival beyond the fixed time of   departure of the   approved work schedule. day , day
texts.text: 4 A fifteen (15)-minute grace period shall be allowed for DepEd officials or employees under the Fixed Flexible Work Schedule, regardless of number of times in a month_ However, in order to complete the required eight (8) hours of work in a the number of minutes of late arrival in a may be offset by staying for an equivalent number of minutes of late arrival beyond the fixed time of   departure of the   approved work schedule. day , day

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: b. Skeleton Workforce
texts.text: b. Skeleton Workforce

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: i Skeleton workforce shall be adopted only when full staffing is not possible during emergency cases such as during an occurrence of transportation strike, pandemic, or other extreme circumstances.
texts.text: i Skeleton workforce shall be adopted only when full staffing is not possible during emergency cases such as during an occurrence of transportation strike, pandemic, or other extreme circumstances.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ii. The total number of   DepEd Personnel to make up the skeleton workforce shall be determined by the Heads of Functional Office based on the considerations and parameters provided in Section v.1.c of this policy.
texts.text: The total number of   DepEd Personnel to make up the skeleton workforce shall be determined by the Heads of Functional Office based on the considerations and parameters provided in Section v.1.c of this policy.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: iii.DepEd Personnel assigned as skeleton workforce shall comply with the normal working hours of not less than eight (8) hours a exclusive of time for lunch. day ,
texts.text: iii.DepEd Personnel assigned as skeleton workforce shall comply with the normal working hours of not less than eight (8) hours a exclusive of time for lunch. day ,

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: iv.DepEd Personnel who failed to report to office onsite on their assigned working shall be considered absent, either as an authorized or unauthorized vacation leave, as applicable, unless a medical certificate is presented to avail of sick leave of absence. days
texts.text: iv.DepEd Personnel who failed to report to office onsite on their assigned working shall be considered absent, either as an authorized or unauthorized vacation leave, as applicable, unless a medical certificate is presented to avail of sick leave of absence. days

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: C Work-From-Home (WFH)
texts.text: C Work-From-Home (WFH)

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1 Work From Home arrangement for employees under extreme medical and situational conditions may be allowed for the following circumstances, subject to the approval of the Head of Functional Office: only
texts.text: 1 Work From Home arrangement for employees under extreme medical and situational conditions may be allowed for the following circumstances, subject to the approval of the Head of Functional Office: only

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a DepEd officials and employees under extreme medical conditions who can physically and mentally perform regular work assignment in his /her permanent or temporary residence upon the recommendation and certification by his /her attending physician:
texts.text: a DepEd officials and employees under extreme medical conditions who can physically and mentally perform regular work assignment in his /her permanent or temporary residence upon the recommendation and certification by his /her attending physician:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1 Those recuperating from illness or sickness such as Osteogenesis Imperfecta, cancer, diabetes mellitus, chronic kidney disease, and other analogous diseases;
texts.text: 1 Those recuperating from illness or sickness such as Osteogenesis Imperfecta, cancer, diabetes mellitus, chronic kidney disease, and other analogous diseases;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3 Those with high-risk pregnancies.
texts.text: 3 Those with high-risk pregnancies.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Those who suffered from accidents affecting mobility;
texts.text: Those who suffered from accidents affecting mobility;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b DepEd officials and employees residing or are currently located in areas affected by the following situational conditions:
texts.text: b DepEd officials and employees residing or are currently located in areas affected by the following situational conditions:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. Emergence of a national or local outbreak of a severe infectious disease (i.e. COVID-19 virus);
texts.text: Emergence of a national or local outbreak of a severe infectious disease (i.e. COVID-19 virus);

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Transportation strike.
texts.text: Transportation strike.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2 Calamity-stricken area due to an occurrence of natural or man-made calamities wherein roads are inaccessible and /or the employee is stranded;
texts.text: 2 Calamity-stricken area due to an occurrence of natural or man-made calamities wherein roads are inaccessible and /or the employee is stranded;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ii Requests for WFH arrangement shall be accompanied by the following documents. Failure to submit the necessary documentation may result in the denial of the request, without prejudice to the of an appropriate leave application: filing
texts.text: ii Requests for WFH arrangement shall be accompanied by the following documents. Failure to submit the necessary documentation may result in the denial of the request, without prejudice to the of an appropriate leave application: filing

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: iii. In cases of sudden declaration of State of National Calamity by the Office of the President or concerned Local Government Unit, when there is disruption of work such as imposition of lockdown, quarantine, offices may shift to a Work from Home arrangement;, as approved by the Head of Functional Office, unless a declaration of
texts.text: In cases of sudden declaration of State of National Calamity by the Office of the President or concerned Local Government Unit, when there is disruption of work such as imposition of lockdown, quarantine, offices may shift to a Work from Home arrangement;, as approved by the Head of Functional Office, unless a declaration of

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: iv. Officials and employees availing WFH must have adequate and appropriate communication equipment; tools, and connectivity to perform his /her assigned tasks and facilitate coordination, consultation, and administrative processes.
texts.text: Officials and employees availing WFH must have adequate and appropriate communication equipment; tools, and connectivity to perform his /her assigned tasks and facilitate coordination, consultation, and administrative processes.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: V WFH may be adopted as a regular work arrangement through the combination of FWA as indicated in Section V.3.d of this issuance_ only
texts.text: V WFH may be adopted as a regular work arrangement through the combination of FWA as indicated in Section V.3.d of this issuance_ only

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: vi. The fixed work schedule for the WFH arrangement shall be from 8:00 am to 05.00 pm only. DepEd officials and employees shall report their time-in and time-out to their   respective Heads of Functional Office or immediate supervisor through the agreed mode of communication to record their actual time (in and out) and reflect the same in the Individual Daily Log and Accomplishment Report (IDLAR) (Annex D). log
texts.text: The fixed work schedule for the WFH arrangement shall be from 8:00 am to 05.00 pm only. DepEd officials and employees shall report their time-in and time-out to their   respective Heads of Functional Office or immediate supervisor through the agreed mode of communication to record their actual time (in and out) and reflect the same in the Individual Daily Log and Accomplishment Report (IDLAR) (Annex D). log

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: vii. The IDLAR shall reflect the time and actual accomplishments of the employee for the No record of time and accomplishment shall mean that no work / service has been rendered / performed for the thus subjecting the personnel to absence. logs day. log day ,
texts.text: The IDLAR shall reflect the time and actual accomplishments of the employee for the No record of time and accomplishment shall mean that no work / service has been rendered / performed for the thus subjecting the personnel to absence. logs day. log day ,

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The time and attendance shall likewise be reflected in the Daily Time Records (DTRs) duly approved the respective Head of Functional Office; by
texts.text: The time and attendance shall likewise be reflected in the Daily Time Records (DTRs) duly approved the respective Head of Functional Office; by

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: viii. The Heads of  Functional Office or immediate   supervisor shall provide the tasks to be performed of the DepEd official or employee concerned to the full extent possible in terms of person-days per workweek
texts.text: The Heads of  Functional Office or immediate   supervisor shall provide the tasks to be performed of the DepEd official or employee concerned to the full extent possible in terms of person-days per workweek

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ix. DepEd officials and employees under WFH shall make themselves available and accessible during working hours, and must be able to
texts.text: DepEd officials and employees under WFH shall make themselves available and accessible during working hours, and must be able to

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: respond to directives, requests, and queries through agreed modes of communication with their immediate supervisor and co-workers_
texts.text: respond to directives, requests, and queries through agreed modes of communication with their immediate supervisor and co-workers_

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: X. DepEd officials and employees under this arrangement shall not be entitled to Compensatory Overtime Credit or Overtime Pay .
texts.text: DepEd officials and employees under this arrangement shall not be entitled to Compensatory Overtime Credit or Overtime Pay .

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: d. Combination of Flexible Work Arrangements
texts.text: d. Combination of Flexible Work Arrangements

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: i Offices may adopt a combination of Skeleton Workforce and WFH arrangement as their regular work set-up for DepEd Personnel; as may be applicable: This arrangement shall be limited to one (1) WFH and four (4) at Skeleton Workforce or on-site reporting: day days
texts.text: i Offices may adopt a combination of Skeleton Workforce and WFH arrangement as their regular work set-up for DepEd Personnel; as may be applicable: This arrangement shall be limited to one (1) WFH and four (4) at Skeleton Workforce or on-site reporting: day days

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ii. DepEd officials and employees under this arrangement may choose the of their preferred WFH arrangement between Tuesday to Friday only, subject to the approval of the Heads of Functional Office. Heads of Functional Office shall ensure the equal distribution of employees present on-site per day day.
texts.text: DepEd officials and employees under this arrangement may choose the of their preferred WFH arrangement between Tuesday to Friday only, subject to the approval of the Heads of Functional Office. Heads of Functional Office shall ensure the equal distribution of employees present on-site per day day.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: VI Procedures
texts.text: VI Procedures

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1 Upon consultation with his/her respective DepEd Personnel and proper assessment of the needs and mandates of the Office, Heads of functional offices shall prepare the Summary of Personnel Under Flexible Work Arrangement (Annex B.1 and B.2) . DepEd Personnel shall affix their respective signatures as sign of concurrence to the selected FWA.
texts.text: 1 Upon consultation with his/her respective DepEd Personnel and proper assessment of the needs and mandates of the Office, Heads of functional offices shall prepare the Summary of Personnel Under Flexible Work Arrangement (Annex B.1 and B.2) . DepEd Personnel shall affix their respective signatures as sign of concurrence to the selected FWA.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2 Heads of Functional Office shall also be responsible for monitoring and ensuring equal distribution of the work arrangements of DepEd personnel, to be submitted to the Head of Office concerned as follows:
texts.text: 2 Heads of Functional Office shall also be responsible for monitoring and ensuring equal distribution of the work arrangements of DepEd personnel, to be submitted to the Head of Office concerned as follows:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3 The approved request of the respective offices shall be submitted to the Personnel Division / section /unit not later than the fourth week of the preceding month for monitoring and recording purposes.
texts.text: 3 The approved request of the respective offices shall be submitted to the Personnel Division / section /unit not later than the fourth week of the preceding month for monitoring and recording purposes.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 4 Except for Fixed Flexitime; the DepEd Personnel and /or Office may change the assigned FWA on a monthly basis subject to the consent of the DepEd Personnel, as may be applicable, and submission of the approved Request for Change of Flexible Work Arrangement (Annex C), if applicable, together with the updated Summary of Personnel under FWA (Annex B.1/B.2) to
texts.text: 4 Except for Fixed Flexitime; the DepEd Personnel and /or Office may change the assigned FWA on a monthly basis subject to the consent of the DepEd Personnel, as may be applicable, and submission of the approved Request for Change of Flexible Work Arrangement (Annex C), if applicable, together with the updated Summary of Personnel under FWA (Annex B.1/B.2) to

texts.label: text
texts.orig: the Personnel Division/ Section /Unit, not later than fourth week of the preceding month_
texts.text: the Personnel Division/ Section /Unit, not later than fourth week of the preceding month_

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Non-submission of an updated Summary of Personnel under FWA shall denote the status quo of the current work arrangement.
texts.text: Non-submission of an updated Summary of Personnel under FWA shall denote the status quo of the current work arrangement.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: VII. Grievance Mechanism
texts.text: VII. Grievance Mechanism

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Concerns, complaints, and /or violations arising from the implementation of this policy shall be addressed through the grievance machinery provided under DO No. 35, 2004 (Revision of the Grievance Machineries of the Department of Education) or pertinent rules on administrative cases in the civil service.
texts.text: Concerns, complaints, and /or violations arising from the implementation of this policy shall be addressed through the grievance machinery provided under DO No. 35, 2004 (Revision of the Grievance Machineries of the Department of Education) or pertinent rules on administrative cases in the civil service.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: VIII. Monitoring and Evaluation
texts.text: VIII. Monitoring and Evaluation

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1 The Head of Functional Office shall be responsible for the strict adherence to and implementation of these guidelines and shall regularly monitor and evaluate the implementation of this policy within their jurisdiction_ In addition, shall establish a systematic feedback mechanism to address and report any policy or implementation issues that may arise. they
texts.text: 1 The Head of Functional Office shall be responsible for the strict adherence to and implementation of these guidelines and shall regularly monitor and evaluate the implementation of this policy within their jurisdiction_ In addition, shall establish a systematic feedback mechanism to address and report any policy or implementation issues that may arise. they

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2 The Bureau of   Human Resource and Organizational Development Personnel Division (BHROD-PD) shall be   responsible for the overall supervision and monitoring of the implementation of this policy in all governance levels, together with the Personnel Section in RO and Personnel Unit in SDO_ In addition, the Personnel Section in RO and Personnel Unit in SDO may also submit their policy recommendations whenever deemed necessary
texts.text: 2 The Bureau of   Human Resource and Organizational Development Personnel Division (BHROD-PD) shall be   responsible for the overall supervision and monitoring of the implementation of this policy in all governance levels, together with the Personnel Section in RO and Personnel Unit in SDO_ In addition, the Personnel Section in RO and Personnel Unit in SDO may also submit their policy recommendations whenever deemed necessary

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3 The BHROD-PD shall consolidate the policy recommendations and ensure that issues and concerns are properly documented and elevated to the DepEd Executive Committee in aid of future policy enhancement
texts.text: 3 The BHROD-PD shall consolidate the policy recommendations and ensure that issues and concerns are properly documented and elevated to the DepEd Executive Committee in aid of future policy enhancement

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 4 The Department   may issue subsequent issuances and supplemental guidelines to further implement this Order in the event of additional requirements set by national laws or policies; or as may be necessary .
texts.text: 4 The Department   may issue subsequent issuances and supplemental guidelines to further implement this Order in the event of additional requirements set by national laws or policies; or as may be necessary .

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: X Effectivity
texts.text: X Effectivity

texts.label: text
texts.orig: This DepEd Order shall take effect fifteen (15) from its approval, issuance, and publication on its website and shall remain in force, unless otherwise repealed, rescinded, or modified accordingly. Certified of this Order shall be registered with the University of the Philippines Law Center-Office of the National Administrative Register (UPLC-ONAR) , UP Diliman, Quezon days copies City .
texts.text: This DepEd Order shall take effect fifteen (15) from its approval, issuance, and publication on its website and shall remain in force, unless otherwise repealed, rescinded, or modified accordingly. Certified of this Order shall be registered with the University of the Philippines Law Center-Office of the National Administrative Register (UPLC-ONAR) , UP Diliman, Quezon days copies City .

texts.orig: XI. Repealing Clause
texts.text: XI. Repealing Clause
